We've never experienced that before and it was a nice touch. He even gave us a bag at checkin that had a couple bottles of water and a snack, he said it was the hotels way of "thanking us" for being a Priority Club member with Holiday Inn. This hotel has it right. Later, he helped us with directions to a couple shows we were going to see. The breakfast was a nice variety and we were surprised to see such a selection, we were not expecting it. We enjoyed the SW-style omelets and the ham patties were fantastic! But the real attraction of the breakfast is Cathy, the hostess. Friendly and went above and beyond in servicing us and the whole room. She was busy, but you never knew it, she kept everything well stocked and hot. I hope everyone who reads this has the experience we had and I will stay at this hotel again when I visit Branson. It's one of the nicest hotels we have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and sophisticated.”
Reviews.Author: REL62360
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly suprised. Took advantage of the guest laundry. Pool was nice and breakfast was better than average. Fitness Room open 24 hrs. - but the treadmill was out of order.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC, BEST HOTEL IN BRANSON !”
Reviews.Author: tikiscott
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at the HI Express Branson-Green Mountain for three nights and we had such a FANTASTIC time! The staff was very friendly and seemed to be on top of everything we might have needed...and we never had to ask for anything! The breakfast lady, Cathy, was an absolute joy to see each morning and the food was delicious and never ran out, even though the breakfast area was packed the ENTIRE time for breakfast. There is a new manager there and we could tell...everywhere we went, he was there asking us how our stay was going and making sure we had everything we needed...just like the rest of the staff. We can't wait to come back again this Winter to enjoy your great new indoor pool, it was just a pleasure to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service and accommodation at a competitive price”
Reviews.Author: padre_41
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was away from the strip in Branson on a large well-landscaped piece of property. The room was tastefully decorated, convenient, and quiet. The complimentary breakfast was superior to most we had on a 38 day trip. The manager mentioned that the hotel is under new management and every effort is being made to provide exceptional service. That certainly is what we received.

Reviews.Title: “Went from very bad to very, very good!”
Reviews.Author: bushlamo
Reviews.Content: We used to stay at this hotel in past years, but then everything got worse, and worse, and worse. Was surprised they were able to keep the Holiday Inn Express brand. That said, kept reading good reviews on TripAdvisor, so decided to give the hotel another chance. It's under new ownership and new management, and the difference is absolutely amazing! From the moment we checked in we were impressed. All of the front desk staff was professional and friendly. The hotel lobby has been remodeled and looks great. They have made the old outdoor pool indoors, added a new hot tub, and it was very inviting. The rooms were up to expecations, the breakfast was great, and it is definitely back on our list of great places to stay in Branson. Congratulations for a job well done, and thank you very much for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in Branson”
Reviews.Author: vacationwoman6786
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my stay at this wonderful hotel. The hotel is in a perfect, quick and easy to get to location (once you learn the shortcuts), grounds were beautifully kept, and the staff (from front desk to housekeepers) were the friendliest I have come across in the states. The room is a nice size and the beds extremely comfortable. The breakfast was nice, staff super and the new pool is gorgeous. Beautiful pool furniture. You will be thrilled with your stay at this HI Express.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2girlsofmine
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at this hotel. The beds were comfy & the rooms were just the right size. I personally loved the fact that I could barely hear anyone or anything ( like the elevators or slamming of doors.) This hotel is a few blocks away from the main drag. So if you want to be in the thick of things you can be there shortly or stay around your hotel and have some relaxing time. If you need tickets to shows, they can help you get them right in the hotel. Staff requests are taken care of quickly and by the way, breakfast is great too. If you are on your way to Branson, you should check this hotel out!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, beautiful hotel. Friendliest staff I've ever met. Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Superman07
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Holiday Inn Express on Green Mountain Drive in Branson, Missouri this month and enjoyed it very much. With so many entertainment options in Branson, I was grateful to the ticket office lady in the lobby. She was very helpful and helped me to plan my time. I visited two shows and had a lovely meal. When I returned, I was pleased to find my room was very clean and comfortable. Breakfast was delicious and the breakfast lady was delightful. I also would like to commend the front desk staff who were full of smiles and helpful information whenever I needed it. I enjoyed my stay and plan to return to this hotel every time I visit Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Branson getaway, romantic and elegant amid down home and cozy”
Reviews.Author: tpruept
Reviews.Content: The desk staff at this hotel were friendly and effiecient. They cordinated our bookings, (one night business, one leisure) and called after we arrived in our room to see if we needed anything else. The linens and towels are upgraded, the room already chilled. The breakfast lady!, oh she was hustling, she kept a hungry bunch well fed. This location serves a full breakfast of scrambled eggs, bacon, biscuts and gravy along with pastries, yogurt, cereal, juice and coffee. It is centrally located just behind the busy 76 strip, easy to get to the attraction or show of your choice. This hotel is worth the little extra for all the little extras it provides (including nice indoor pool and fitness room), even in the busy summer months.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite place to stay when visiting Branson.”
Reviews.Author: LloydJean
Reviews.Content: The rooms are great. Always clean. Perfect location allowing for easy access to places we frequent. Great breakfast provided. A plus for us is in room coffee. Checking in and out easy. The staff ready to help and always pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “A vacation saver”
Reviews.Author: apdchief
Reviews.Content: We had a very bad experience at the Stone Castle and at 11pm of the first nights stay, I called the Holiday Inn Express just down the street. They were extremely helpful and the hotel was great we stayed for two nights. We will stay here each time we come to Branson. Best service possible. So much better than the other place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, would recommend to everyone !!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Xtie_58
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel under new management and I found it to be excellent. The staff is very good. Room are very clean and the service is second to none. I am a frequent traveller and and stay on the road 60 to 100 times per year. This hotel and staff compares to any place i stay.

Reviews.Title: “Under new management not so good”
Reviews.Author: MGMG79
Reviews.Content: This was the third year that my mom and I stayed at this HI Express. They were quick to tell us they were under new mgt. The room was never vacuumed during our week stay; neither was the room of my friend and her mom. I had to ask for tissues and plastic cups. The carpets were dirty. The breakfast was WONDERFUL!! The woman in charge is friendly and keeps everything stocked.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Karla F
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights with our 2 daughters, while we visited Branson for Silver Dollar City and White Water. This hotel did NOT live up to the good reviews. Pros: - Breakfast included; the lady who runs the breakfast buffet does a wonderful job and is extremely personable to the guests - Location; it is on a side road, so you can avoid some of the crazy Branson traffic - Felix at the front desk; great customer service and very friendly Cons: - NO POOL!! Their website did NOT state that they had closed their outdoor pool, only that they were working to add an indoor pool. They even show a picture of their outdoor pool on their website. Very deceptive!! They did offer for us to use the Comfort Inn pool up the street, but what a pain that was. - Housekeeping; they did not replenish any items in the room (i.e. soap, toilet paper, kleenex, etc.) We had to hunt them down and specifically ask for those items. The second day housekeeping did not even show up, and we had to call the front desk at 3pm and request that housekeeping be sent. The guy that showed up could not speak a word of English and therefore could not understand me asking for certain things. - The room; was dinky, dinky, dinky. I know this is not a luxury hotel, but really for a family of 4 (two adults and two kids), their room with two beds was way too cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay that's close yet out of the way”
Reviews.Author: PorterTabor
Reviews.Content: The Holiday INN Express on green mountain drive is defenitely better than the one on 76. It's a much newer building and is way cleaner. I prefer to be on green mountain drive because it is quieter. The hotel is still within walking distance of most ammenities on the strip. The staff is wonderful and the breakfast is perfect. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the area.

Reviews.Title: “HIX on Green Mountain Drive, enjoy Comfort, Quality, Value, Convience”
Reviews.Author: Diamnjim51
Reviews.Content: A while back, we enjoyed a great stay at the Holiday Inn Express on Green Mountain Drive in Branson, Mo. So it was an easy choice as to where we wanted to stay over the Memorial Day weekend. Again, we were not disappointed! The hotel has had some major renovations made and more to come. The lobby received a face lift with new furniture inside and a new entrance that helps keep out the weather. Outside the lawn work makes the place look so attractive. In the near future, the enclosed pool will be completed. Families with children will be able to enjoy the water year round in this conditioned atmosphere. The addition of the fitness room is great for runners, fitness fanatics or just for us older people who like to take a morning stroll without facing traffic or weather issues. Comfortable beds, clean bathrooms, and very good breakfast food makes the quality and value of the hotel excellent. Add to that the personality of the staff and you have a very special treat in store if you choose to stay at this hotel. It is on the yellow route which can take you quickly to the "blue" and "red" routes and get you around all the traffic on Highway 76. The hotel location makes access to Tanger Mall and the many shows so easy. If you haven't tried this hotel, on your next trip to Branson, drop in on Mr. Lynn Worley and his staff. Odds are, you'll enjoy your stay so much you'll find a new 'home away from home' like we have. Jim and Carlene Spurgers Litte Rock, Arkansas

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Sr. Trip”
Reviews.Author: cnzsmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a group of 14 for our high school's Sr. trip. The rooms were comfortable and clean. Breakfast was wonderful and the hotel was convenient to all the sites. The hotel pool was under construction and will be nice once it is finished. The hotel did offer the use of another nearby hotel. The front desk staff was excellent! Very helpful and friendly. Everyone in Missouri at least in that area was super friendly and we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Branson1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for a recent weekend getaway. We were well pleased with our room and the staff. The hotel itself is attractive both inside and out.

Reviews.Title: “Branson's best for the money”
Reviews.Author: carlos123456
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our 49th anniversary in Branson at the Holiday Inn Express. The Staff and management were probally the nicest and most helpful of any motel I have ever stayed in, and before my retirement I had stayed in motels for 35 years. The room was very clean and smelled that way, and the breakfast is very hard to beat anywhere. I definitely recommend this motel.

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to the next visit !!”
Reviews.Author: turtleladyMo
Reviews.Content: Customer service at its best ! From the moment you step into the lobby through the check-out process you are treated with friendliness and competency. A smile and eye contact was always part of services offered from all staff members. Great location, cleanliness. Super breakfast ! Awesome bedding with choices of soft or firm pillows made it a challenge to get up in the morning! A special thanks to all staff for adding the human touch, an important part in making our stay enjoyable... Great place to stay. We look forward to our next visit !!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: DoverDolphinGirl
Reviews.Content: Excellent room at an incredible price. We stayed in the king suite and loved the room and the hotel in general. The people at the front desk were very helpful, friendly and made us feel right at home. We will definitely be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value! Great Service! Great Time! Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: SEVMEISTER
Reviews.Content: I was very fortunate to book this room the night before my stay and found a most reasonable rate ( with all taxes it was just under $80 ) I am a Priority Club Member which I would recommend all to join since there is no charge. Upon arriving, I was pleasantly greeted by the Asst. GM and the Front Desk Clerk. I was recognized as a Priority Club Member and was given a complimentary room upgrade. The room was fantastic. It had a king sized bed, microwave, fridge, desk, chair, ottoman, couch, and a jacuzzi tub. The only thing it was missing was a second room and a second TV. (The recipe for a totally happy marriage - his and hers TV's ) The room was clean, fresh, and comfortable. Our night there was most relaxing. Our experience for breakfast was most pleasing. First off, Cathy the Breakfast Attendant treated my wife and I like family. She went above and beyond to make sure our breakfast experience was a great one. When and if we return to the Branson area The Holiday Inn Express on Green Mount Road will be number one on my "Where to Stay" list.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully updated hotel with excellent staff and more updates in the works.”
Reviews.Author: KJDL
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a pleasure to stay in a beautiful place with excellent staff and exciting changes in the works for a good price!

Reviews.Title: “Treated special every visit!!!”
Reviews.Author: McDsTravelingGal
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler to this destination and always stay at this location. I'm greeted by name, have a speedy check-in and asked if I need anything for my stay. Green Mountain Drive is my home away from home. I'm impressed with the hotels "re-imaging process" and all of the new amenities that will make my stays even better!! The staff is wonderful - part of my extended familly. The location of this hotel is great, within walking distance to many attractions and restaurants. I always recommend this location to my friends and family when visiting Branson- Make it Yours!!!

Reviews.Title: “Finally a newer and clean inn at a decent price in Branson”
Reviews.Author: ARTravelmamma
Reviews.Content: We travel to Branson several times a year for a quick getaway and to enjoy Silver Dollar City, shopping, and family. We had yet to find a newer, clean and quiet motel/hotel at a decent price for one or two night stays (on longer stays we typically book at one of the many timeshare condos available in Branson). I'm happy to say that this Holiday Inn has what we've been looking for all of these years! In addition to the clean and quiet rooms the inn offers a free hot breakfast that was very good. If you have ever traveled to Branson before, you have probably experienced some very bad "free" hot breakfasts other hotel/motels offer. What a nice surprise to have one that was so fresh and offered such a good variety of food. I was nervous in initially booking this room based on prior tripadvisor reviews, but found out from the staff (who were very friendly and accommodating) that they were bought by new owners and were closed from Dec. 09-Mar 10 to get the inn up to par. They are also in the process of putting in a good sized indoor pool and fitness center that they hope to have opened in time for Memorial Day. We plan on staying at this Holiday Inn again on our next visit to Branson and expect to have the same great experience.

Reviews.Title: “BEST place we've stayed in Branson, MO”
Reviews.Author: Allie2009
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd attempt to find a clean, decent motel in Branson, MO. I was a bit apprehensive when I read this Holiday Inn had been remodeled. We'd had a previous experience that said the same thing about the LaQuinta in Branson and it was worse than awful (stinky room, paper thin walls, dirty bathrooms and priced higher than Holiday Inn Express on Green Mountain Dr.). When we walked into the Holiday Inn Express on Green Mountain Dr., they'd only been open a few days after being closed for remodeling. We checked in and the people at the front desk were friendly and very accommodating. Then, we went to our room, opened the door and it was SO refreshing to walk into a room that smelled good, looked good AND the bathroom was clean and modern! The staff we met were all helpful and excited about the new owners that had purchased the motel earlier in the year. We met Mr. Lynn Worley, the Hotel General Manager who told us the motel had been purchased by new owners that believed in doing renovations right the first time. He was right. Everything was nice, clean and looked new! The free breakfast provided was good, prepared well and the area was clean and inviting. Breakfast items included, milk, juices, coffee, tea, omelettes, bacon, sausage, biscuits, gravy, dry cereals, sweet rolls, toast, fruit, and yogurt. The experience we had at the Holiday Inn Express on Green Mountain Dr. in Branson, Mo was very relaxing, refreshing and beyond our expectations and we can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Clean, Comfortable, Friendly Staff and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Snowmanlady
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at this Holiday Inn Express two years ago and found no problems which brought us back. This was the case again this year. We walked in without reservations. We requested to be on the top floor and that request was honored. The staff at the front desk was very friendly. An apology was made because the computer was being slow. The room was clean, comfortable and quiet. The hot breakfast is an added plus and the staff working the breakfast room was friendly as well. We would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: da1985bears
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights, only because we had 2-free nights. My husband is recovering from back surgery so we requested a room on the frist floor, these rooms are disabled accessble. No vanity in bathroom and rooms smelled like a nursing home.

Reviews.Title: “My worst stay at a Holiday Inn Express ever!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bgray10569
Reviews.Content: First I must say that I checked 2 weeks before arriving in Branson on my reservations. I checked again 4 days prior to our arrival. That means everything should have been great. I had reserved a suite which we used every time we have been to Branson (4 times). When I got to the desk I was told they had no more suites and would have to stay in a regular room. While I'm standing there someone else comes in and wants a suite and they got it. I was told that my credit card was no good and my phone had been discontected. Which were both lies. The room they put us in was so small. Forget the bathroom it was dirty, there was mold on the shower curtain and the bathroom floor was dirty. My cousin took a bath and could not turn off the water. It was so hot in there 3 of us tried to turn it off and had to call the front desk. The next day I was promised a suite which the people decided they wanted a late check out and got it at 2:00 pm we were still not in our room and had to load our luggage on a cart and put it down stairs so we could go get lunch. It was after 3:00 before we could get into our room.We missed shows because of this I was told just reschedule your shows. I have always given Holiday Inn Express & suites in Branson a 5 star rating it is hard for me to give even a 2 star. Rude and lieing staff that could careless if you stay or not. I love the location but they disappionted me this time. I can't say if I will ever be back.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms are decorated like the Mariott”
Reviews.Author: pegiot
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights. The beds have all new linens with 4 pillows on each bed--labeled soft or firm. The pool was adequate with unusual lounging furniture. The lobby was very beautiful and newly decorated. Breakfast was an unexpected surprise - There were eggs and bacon, biscuits and gravy, in addition to the continental items. Several of the Branson entertainers came in during breakfast with discount tickets to their shows. Since we hadn't committed one day, we visited some of these shows and they were great and a great price.

Reviews.Title: “The worst HIE experience I have ever had”
Reviews.Author: drugcop4
Reviews.Content: The room smelled like old guy sweat and cheap old spice. The AC was broken, when asked to fix they did and within an hour the fan was rattling sounding like a fire alarm. They had the gall to offer 15% off our next stay "at regular price" as a fix for the problem. I refused to pay for one night and should have not paid at all. This was the worst hotel stay I have had in my life. The fact that they are allowed to carry the Holiday Inn logo is a crime. Stay away, there are many other decent hotels close, even the mom and pops would have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Well kept property in a very convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: ARtraveler63
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival to the property, I was immediately concerned as I could tell there was construction going on in the lobby. The lobby was being redone, and they were in the midst of hanging new chandeliers, but this did not pose a problem, and the result was absolutely beautiful. The carpet in the halls and in our room also looked like it had been recently replaced. Check in was efficient and speedy. Our room on the second floor was just doors from the breakfast area. The room was clean and smelled fresh. There is a bathroom with shower and sink, and a separate sink outside the bathroom, a plus feature even though the bathroom was small. The bed and bedding was very comfortable. The breakfast area was comfortable and roomy. Breakfast was more than anticipated with eggs and biscuits and gravy along with muffins, bagels, sweet rolls, etc. The breakfast attendant was pleasant as she hurried about her duties. There is an outside pool, but we were there too early in the season for it to be opened. Cost of the room was very reasonable. The property is located within minutes of several theatres on Hwy 76, Tanger Mall, and several excellent restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “I had a nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: YankeeRose1970
Reviews.Content: We originally booked a room for me, my husband and two teenagers well in advance. Unexpectantly, my grandmother who was traveling with us, was supposed to stay at a friends house outside of Branson and due to unforseen circumstances my grandmother was unable to. The front desk staff was extremely helpful and friendly in accomodating us by giving us the adjoining room for my grandmother. The room was very clean when we opened the door. We were on the floor that leads out to the pool. Our room opened right to the pool side. The grounds outside the room were a bit dirty with thrown cigerette butts and some papers but overall not too bad. The hours for the pool weren't bad either. It got rather loud sometimes but we weren't there to hang out in the hotel room anyway. The beds were comfortable and the hotel was very quiet at night. The windows had those curtains that block out sunlight which is very helpful when you travel with teens! The hotel is ideally located by several attractions. We go to Branson almost every year and I would highly recommend this hotel! The continental breakfast was something to be desired though. A bit generic and sometimes bland but there are restaurants close by. The free breakfast is just convenient when you're in a hurry. Would I stay here again? Sure!

Reviews.Title: “Good value at the Holiday Inn Express”
Reviews.Author: NCD0003
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Holiday Inn Express off of Green Mtn Rd this past weekend for a shopping trip. I picked this hotel because I wanted to have a nice and clean room with a good location and good price. The other Holiday Inn Express is a block away on the strip and is about $30-$40 higher per room. Finding the hotel was difficult and hotel staff was a little rude and unprofessional. The hotel clerk did not know how to do a transaction with cash..she said people normally paid with credit cards and that's all she knew how to ring up. After about 15 minutes and tracking down the manager, we were able to check in to our room. Our double queen room was nicely decorated and clean. The beds were really comfortable and included firm and soft pillows for your preference. We were located by the elevator but the room was very quiet and we had a nice view from our window. The breakfast in the morning had a nice selection. There was fruit, yogurt, eggs, sausage, biscuits and gravy, danishes, donuts, and muffins. We ate there the first night but opted to go elsewhere the second morning. The food tasted okay...standard continental breakfast. The hotel is located right off the strip and close to several fast food places, restuarants, and Walmart. The pool was really small and located outside. The sign said spa but I didn't explore the hotel and see it. Overall, our two nights were comfy. I liked: price, location, cleanliness of room, comfort of room I disliked: hotel staff, outside pool

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel !”
Reviews.Author: txmar
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the quality of this hotel. The exercise room and self service laundry were very handy also. Our room was clean and quiet,which ,considering all the traffic outside,was great. The front desk staff was very friendly and accommodating,and the lobby was very nice. There were lots of families in and out with children,but we couldn't hear them once we were in our room. The hot breakfast was nice and had plenty of choices.. This hotel is set back from the street and is a lot quieter than the previous one we stayed in.(Ugh-Branson's Best) The only downside was that the room that we got didn't have a refrigerator or microwave. We did get a great rate though. (70.00 for state/fed employees).

Reviews.Title: “A Ncie Stay”
Reviews.Author: BhamBuddy
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in this HIE and our stay was good. We had a double queen room and with two adults and 3 kids, it was a little cramped, but worked well for our needs. The rooms were nice and functional. The hotel has an outdoor pool that the kids enjoyed. Breakfast in the morning was good, but crowded. Chalk it up to summer. The lady handling the breakfast area deserved kudos in keeping up with demand. The location is on the yellow route which was nice because we were able to get into and out of the hotel easily. I would recommend this Holiday Inn Express.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express Branson - Green Mountain Drive
HotelInfo.Address: 2801 Green Mountain Drive, Branson, MO 65616
